StringTable.Label: IridiumTechTree_Name
StringTable.String: Iridium Tech Tree

StringTable.Label: IridiumTechTree_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Tech tree focused on Commerce.

StringTable.Label: IridiumTechTree_Dec
StringTable.String: Tech tree focused on Commerce.

StringTable.Label: IridiumColonizationTech_Name
StringTable.String: Expansion

StringTable.Label: IridiumColonizationTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Growth is the most fundamental requirement of both a business and a civilization. We cannot allow ourselves to stagnate, confining our business to just one planet. The Iridium Corporation must expand or perish.

StringTable.Label: IridiumXenoIndustrializationTech_Name
StringTable.String: Capital Investment

StringTable.Label: IridiumXenoIndustrializationTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Our corporate empire must be built on a firm foundation. We should ensure our initial colonial buildings are as capable and durable as possible.

StringTable.Label: IridiumIndustrialSpecialization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Streamlining and refining some of our inefficient pre-colonial management techniques should help modernize our industrial sector, and result in both increased manufacturing quality and capacity.

StringTable.Label: IridiumIndustrialSpecialization2_Dec
StringTable.String: Resources directed to our R & D division almost always pay off in newly profitable business opportunities. But that's no excuse for researching wastefully, and with the right audits we can ensure R & D is spending our capital wisely.

StringTable.Label: IridiumIndustrialSpecialization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Maintenance is an inevitable but still distressing drain on our bottom line. Anything we can do to control costs here will benefit almost every aspect of our business.

StringTable.Label: IridiumAdvancedConstruction_Name
StringTable.String: Industrial Investment

StringTable.Label: IridiumAdvancedConstruction_Dec
StringTable.String: Any edge one business has over another in production capacity, however small at first, only widens over time. We should ensure the Iridium Corporation and its network of sub-contractors establish the early, and ultimately permanent lead.

StringTable.Label: IridiumConstructionOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Increased capacity is always welcome, so long as there's demand for what's being produced. And considering the speed we're expanding, demand for our goods is predicted to be very strong for a long time to come.

StringTable.Label: IridiumConstructionOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: More efficient manufacturing processes will reduce wasted materials and bring down manufacturing costs. An always welcome development, so long as these steps don't impede production capacity.

StringTable.Label: IridiumConstructionOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: In our rush to make manufacturing centers, some of our initial designs were not as maintainable as they could have been. Correcting that now will lead to significantly reduced maintenance costs over the life of our factories.

StringTable.Label: IridiumXenoManufacturingMethods_Dec
StringTable.String: A new generation of ultra-precise, high volume manufacturing equipment should allow us to once again expand the capacity of our manufacturing sector.

StringTable.Label: IridiumManufacturingFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: Adjusting our factories to begin specializing in military production will allow our security division to equip itself more rapidly, to better deal with the various high-risk threats this galaxy might throw at us.

StringTable.Label: IridiumManufacturingFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: Continued, relentless growth remains our corporation's number one objective, and improving the speed with which civilian equipment and structures can be built should help increase that growth rate substantially.

StringTable.Label: IridiumManufacturingFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: Anything we can do to make our equipment and structures cheaper to build will be widely appreciated by the board. All of these savings initiatives really do add up.

StringTable.Label: IridiumIndustrialExpertise_Dec
StringTable.String: Iridium production technology is already the envy of the galaxy, our newest factories capable of forging materials from the atomic level up. We're now capable of building things on a scale few ever imagined possible.

StringTable.Label: IridiumIndustrialMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: The aggressive stance taken by our competitors has been the topic of much discussion in the business press. A boost to our military production capacity will ensure the Iridium security division is equipped to face the challenges this market presents.

StringTable.Label: IridiumIndustrialMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: Even at this advanced stage in our expansion plans, there's still room for improving our growth rate. Progress waits for no-one, and if can improve the speed with which we build social and economic structures, all of our business shall benefit.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPracticalFusion_Dec
StringTable.String: Selling cascading fusion reactors to the open market will result in certain security concerns which must be addressed. But the beneficial impact we expect them to have on our manufacturing sector is too great to ignore.

StringTable.Label: IridiumQuantumPower_Dec
StringTable.String: Power plants which draw power from the quantum zero point energy of a vacuum will provide an almost limitless source of energy to our manufacturing centers. There are few problems we won't be able to produce our way out of now.

StringTable.Label: IridiumInstitutionalResearch_Name
StringTable.String: Research & Development

StringTable.Label: IridiumInstitutionalResearch_Dec
StringTable.String: As our business expands out of our home system we're going to be presented with opportunities we can't possibly foresee. A dedicated R & D division will ensure we have the products needed to profit, no matter what comes our way.

StringTable.Label: IridiumResearchOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: By waiving some of the more onerous reporting requirements for our R & D division, and giving them assistants to handle the rest, we should free up more of our researchers' time for doing actual research.

StringTable.Label: IridiumResearchOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: Our quality managers working in R & D have identified a couple requisition processes we can streamline, which should make the equipment our researchers need cheaper to come by.

StringTable.Label: IridiumResearchOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Getting researchers to consider long term maintenance costs when they're kitting out their labs is almost impossible. We've inserted a new oversight process which should ensure that everything we buy is first reviewed for ease of maintenance.

StringTable.Label: IridiumResearchCenters_Name
StringTable.String: Think Tanks

StringTable.Label: IridiumResearchCenters_Dec
StringTable.String: Think tanks are intended to become much more than just basic research facilities. They'll serve as havens, safe places for our most talented thinkers to work with people whose skills compliment their own gifts.

StringTable.Label: IridiumIntegratedResearch_Dec
StringTable.String: In order to keep delivering the pace of breakthroughs R & D is expected to, a new generations of integrated, multi-disciplinary research facilities will be needed.

StringTable.Label: IridiumResearchMatrixTech_Dec
StringTable.String: A city-sized research facility filled with the finest minds our business can produce, should be able to generate breakthroughs at a speed never seen before. Sometimes the answer is as simple as throwing more people at a problem.

StringTable.Label: IridiumDeeperKnowledge_Dec
StringTable.String: A new type of research methodology, characterized by small teams of polymaths that relentlessly pursue the deeper aspects of the universe, is turning up some interesting and very profitable findings.

StringTable.Label: IridiumQuantumUnderstanding_Dec
StringTable.String: Our deep research teams have begun to penetrate the mysteries present in the very fabric of space. Their findings are showing us that a new way of doing business may be just around the corner.

StringTable.Label: IridiumBeyondMortality_Dec
StringTable.String: Ascension will usher the Iridium Corporation into a new reality, allowing the cycle of growth and expansion to begin again.

StringTable.Label: IridiumResearchCoordination_Name
StringTable.String: Information Sharing

StringTable.Label: IridiumResearchCoordination_Dec
StringTable.String: We're masters of process and coordination, and the challenge of organizing research efforts scattered across multiple worlds is nothing to us. Our new Research Coordination Centers will help boost research efforts everywhere.

StringTable.Label: IridiumNeroLinking_Dec
StringTable.String: Brain-to-brain communication poses an incredible opportunity to our research efforts. The ethical impact of this technology is of course substantial and if this technology proves unprofitable, will serve as an excellent excuse for killing the program.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPlanetaryImprovement_Name
StringTable.String: Planetary Enhancement

StringTable.Label: IridiumPlanetaryImprovement_Dec
StringTable.String: Identifying and realizing the potential of a raw resource is one of the most crucial skills in all of business, and colonial development is no different. But we'll require the right tools if we hope to be able to do it consistently.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPlanetarySpecialization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Without enough food, our colonial growth rates will plateau quickly, hurting our corporation's long term potential. Increased food production should ensure that something as trivial as food doesn't become our business' limiting factor.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPlanetarySpecialization2_Dec
StringTable.String: If we're trying to maximize the growth of our business, let's not be bashful about what the fundamental requirement for that will be. Increased population growth will mean more workers, more consumers, and more of everything else.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPlanetarySpecialization3_Dec
StringTable.String: There's no sense having a higher workforce if they're going to work inefficiently. A program of environmental enhancements designed to encourage production will ensure workplace productivity is as high as it can be.

StringTable.Label: IridiumXenoAgriculturalAdaptation_Dec
StringTable.String: Food is one of our most critical commodities, and an increasingly valuable one at that, considering the challenges of producing it in alien environments. Improved farms should help ensure our colonies are as well fed as possible.

StringTable.Label: IridiumAgriculturalOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Farms take up valuable space, which could be used for other, more useful structures. We should preferentially award food supply contracts to suppliers who can generate as much food per unit of area as possible.

StringTable.Label: IridiumAgriculturalOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: Requiring our food suppliers to begin using standardized equipment and pre-fabricated structures should ensure new farms are built as cost effectively as possible.

StringTable.Label: IridiumAgriculturalOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Generating fertilizer and nutrients on an alien planet is a particularly challenging chore, but if we can force our suppliers to do it for us, we'll be able to significantly reduce the costs associated with importing fertilizer from off-world.

StringTable.Label: IridiumIntensiveFarming_Name
StringTable.String: High Yield Crops

StringTable.Label: IridiumIntensiveFarming_Dec
StringTable.String: If we hope to maximize our PopCap/Land ratios - and our colonization managers assure us that we definitely do - then we'll need to develop the most efficient, high yield farms possible.

StringTable.Label: IridiumFarmingFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: Intelligent fertilization dispersal fields, embedded directly in the soil, are capable of monitoring the health and growth rates of crops and directing nutrients to them at the optimal rate, greatly increasing crop yield.

StringTable.Label: IridiumFarmingFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: Our supplier have already automated much of the work on our farms, but by switching from single-use machines to adaptable, multipurpose devices, they should be able to reduce startup costs even more.

StringTable.Label: IridiumFarmingFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: By limiting our selection of crops to the simplest, least labor intensive ones, our supplier have been able to reduce the operating pass-through costs for all of our farms.

StringTable.Label: IridiumLosslessFarming_Dec
StringTable.String: Once we began treating fertilizer with the same scrutiny with which we treat our other capital, we were able to begin constructing almost perfectly efficient farms, every nutrient tracked individually on a molecular level.

StringTable.Label: IridiumAgriculturalMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: Our food suppliers assure us that no room for improvement remains, that we've reached the very limits of agricultural science, our crops now generating as much food as chemistry allows. Which sounds to us like it's time to find some new suppliers.

StringTable.Label: IridiumAgriculturalMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: By making our crops enhance fertility, our food supplier have found a way to turn our business' abundance of food into an abundance of new workers. Who said farming couldn't be sexy?

StringTable.Label: IridiumFoodDistributionTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Dedicated food distribution structures will ensure that food no longer goes bad in storage or transit, which will ultimately increase the food production of an entire planet.

StringTable.Label: IridiumXenoIrrigation_Dec
StringTable.String: Centralizing our irrigation efforts will help us better share and make more efficient use of the significant investment these systems represent. Food production across an entire planet should be increased as a result.

StringTable.Label: IridiumBiomassResequencing_Dec
StringTable.String: Directly sequencing biomass into food products has long been possible, but has never resulted in a very palatable end product. But as a supplement source of fertilizer, it's well suited for increasing the efficiency of all farms on a planet.

StringTable.Label: IridiumXenoBiology_Dec
StringTable.String: We have to ensure our workers are capable of surviving on alien worlds. For moral reasons, morale reasons, and yes, of course, for productivity reasons.

StringTable.Label: IridiumBioReplication_Dec
StringTable.String: Reproduction is too critical to the success of our enterprise to leave in the hands of our workers, and now that we finally have the technology to do something about it, we expect our population growth curves to accelerate dramatically.

StringTable.Label: IridiumEnvironmentalEngineering_Name
StringTable.String: Property Management

StringTable.Label: IridiumEnvironmentalEngineering_Dec
StringTable.String: The terrain of a planet can be managed just like any other resource, and when done properly, leads to smoother and more efficient running facilities.

StringTable.Label: IridiumExtremeWorldColonization_Dec
StringTable.String: We can't ignore the opportunity that extreme worlds present us. Empty land to build upon and grow in is incredibly valuable, even if life might be tough for the workers stationed there.

StringTable.Label: IridiumColonizationFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: Improved floating and submersible structures should help increase the production potential of aquatic planets, making them nearly as productive as everywhere else in our business.

StringTable.Label: IridiumColonizationFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: It took a few iterations and a few lost fingers to finally perfect our frozen world construction practices. But now that we have, we expect production their to rise substantially.

StringTable.Label: IridiumColonizationFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: Thanks to some water recycling products which have recently hit the market, production capacity on barren worlds should now be greatly increased.

StringTable.Label: IridiumAtmosphericCleansing_Dec
StringTable.String: Radioactive and toxic planets pose a challenge to our business activities, but not an insurmountable one. And they provide an avenue for growth that we can simply no longer ignore.

StringTable.Label: IridiumBiospherePerfection1_Dec
StringTable.String: Our workers and managers on radioactive worlds will no longer have to suffer through the random mutations which plagued their careers. Aside from the obvious boost to morale, this should make everyone more productive as well.

StringTable.Label: IridiumBiospherePerfection2_Dec
StringTable.String: All employees and subcontractors are still strongly advised against going outside, but within the confines of our colonial structures, life on toxic worlds is now much more pleasant and productive.

StringTable.Label: IridiumTerraformingTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Making the land itself more productive is an admirable goal, and will allow us to begin making use of some of the more marginal terrain on the planets we establish our business.

StringTable.Label: IridiumHabitatImprovement_Dec
StringTable.String: Natural ecosystems may be pretty, but they're often woefully unusable for modern business purposes. Our latest terraforming equipment should help correct that, which, in a sense, will make them even prettier.

StringTable.Label: IridiumSoilReclamation_Dec
StringTable.String: We can now manage a planet's landmasses with far greater efficiency than nature ever could herself. Almost any terrain on a planet is now potentially usable by us.

StringTable.Label: IridiumEnvironmentalResequencing_Dec
StringTable.String: Environmental Resequencing will increase the usable land on every planet in our corporation, dramatically increasing production potential at the cost of nothing more than a few trillion unproductive plants.

StringTable.Label: IridiumEngineeringTech_Dec
StringTable.String: This new hyperdrive invention is the very definition of a disruptive technology. The Iridium people have never possessed something with such limitless inherent potential. Or risk.

StringTable.Label: IridiumInterstellarTravel_Dec
StringTable.String: We must implement the same best management practices in our space-faring fleets as we have everywhere else. If we wish our business to succeed, improvements in all of our space-faring systems must be found immediately.

StringTable.Label: IridiumInterstellarSpecialization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Faster hyperdrives will speed up our ships and the speed which our business is ultimately capable of expanding.

StringTable.Label: IridiumInterstellarSpecialization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Improved life support recirculation systems will not only ensure the safety of our valuable crews, but extend the range of our ships, and thus expand the list of potential growth opportunities.

StringTable.Label: IridiumIonDriveTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Ion Drives use magnetic fields to capture ions during hyperdrive flight, which are then used as additional reactant mass, making our ships significantly faster, and improving our goal achievability scores.

StringTable.Label: IridiumIonOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: An adjusted magnetic envelope should improve the ion capture technology of our Ion Drives, allowing for increased mass capture and consequently higher speeds.

StringTable.Label: IridiumIonOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: Many of our engine managers, seeking ways to increase their groups' ROI, have identified multiple cost savings measures when installing new ion drives. We should implement these practices fleet wide ASAP.

StringTable.Label: IridiumIonOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Using a new type of field generation coil that's recently come on the market will help make our hyperdrives more mass efficient. A worthy pursuit, seeing as this will leave more room in our vessels for revenue generating equipment.

StringTable.Label: IridiumWarpFieldTheory_Dec
StringTable.String: Internal R & D has found a way to multiply the space-bending properties of hyperfields, leading to the development of so called "Warp Fields." Our ships will now be faster and more productive than ever before.

StringTable.Label: IridiumWarpFieldFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: R & D's experiments with different arrangements of stacked hyperfields has led to a new configuration of Warp Drive which is marginally more effective than previous versions.

StringTable.Label: IridiumWarpFieldFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: Budget crunches can come at any time, and as our drive systems become more expensive, they'll always be a target for cost cutting. Let's instruct R & D to get ahead of the curve and find some cost savings measures before they become necessary.

StringTable.Label: IridiumWarpFieldFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: R & D has found a way to modify an off the shelf product to result in a new, more compact form of hyperfield generator. Achieving the same results as earlier, heavier models, this should make all of our drives a bit lighter.

StringTable.Label: IridiumHyperwarpWaves_Dec
StringTable.String: A Hyperwarp drive allows our ships to travel through space that has effectively been pre-compressed, moving at speeds never seen before. This will give every line of our business an immeasurable advantage in their work.

StringTable.Label: IridiumHyperwarpMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: Our drives are now incredibly economical to build, our engineers' dedication to their craft serving as a shining example to the rest of our company.

StringTable.Label: IridiumHyperwarpMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: Few thought it possible, but R & D has found a few more ways to miniaturize our engines. Our relentless drive for improvement mocks even the laws of physics.

StringTable.Label: IridiumStellarFoldingTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Stellar folding drives will make our ships faster than ever, capable of bringing the Iridium Corporation to the most distant markets in the galaxy.

StringTable.Label: IridiumHyperfieldProjection_Dec
StringTable.String: Speed boosting modules will allow an entire fleet to be sped up by a properly equipped ship. The opportunities such a system allow will be of great use to our fleet managers.

StringTable.Label: IridiumGravityFieldManipulation_Dec
StringTable.String: R & D's recent breakthrough on graviton research will allow us to generate artificial gravity fields on a massive scale, increasing the maneuverability of our ships when faced with high-risk security operations.

StringTable.Label: IridiumHyperfieldDisruption_Dec
StringTable.String: We're now able to use hyperfield technology in our fleet speed boosting modules, increasing their effectiveness. Additionally a new type of related product will allow us to limit the speed of ships that pose a security risk.

StringTable.Label: IridiumStellarFieldProjection_Dec
StringTable.String: Stellar Field Projectors will allow our best ships to boost the speed of every other travelling in their fleet. This incredible technology will give our fleet managers an enormous degree of flexibility when making up fleets.

StringTable.Label: IridiumInterstellarSurvey_Dec
StringTable.String: Our ship managers have to have the right information to operate their ships effectively, and that starts with knowing what's around them. We should direct R & D to begin building better sensor and survey systems.

StringTable.Label: IridiumSensorOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Improving the processing power of our sensor systems will allow them to sift through the information returned to them more effectively, improving their overall performance.

StringTable.Label: IridiumSensorOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: With our network of suppliers eagerly standing by, outsourcing the production of some of our sensor components should result in cost savings.

StringTable.Label: IridiumSensorOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Earlier generations of our sensors were needlessly crude, hardly befitting something which bears an official stamp of the Iridium people. Our latest models use the latest and lightest components, and are far more weight efficient.

StringTable.Label: IridiumEnergyFieldSensors_Dec
StringTable.String: The fields emitted by hyperdrives are detectable at distances far outside their ship's normal light cones. And the latest generation of sensors to come on the market promise to be able to detect those fields at even greater distances than before.

StringTable.Label: IridiumEnergyFieldFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: By installing a new model of shielding around our sensor equipment, we can reduce interference generated from our own engines, allowing our sensors to operate just a bit more effectively.

StringTable.Label: IridiumEnergyFieldFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: By adjusting the layout of our sensor bays, standardizing them with the latest generation of sensor systems on the market, we should be able to greatly reduce installation costs for all new sensor packages.

StringTable.Label: IridiumEnergyFieldFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: Switching our field-sensing arrays with higher density models should lead to more compact sensors. However important they are, sensors are rarely a ship's most critical piece of equipment, and weight savings found here will be well used elsewhere.

StringTable.Label: IridiumSubspaceSensors_Dec
StringTable.String: R & D had recently developed a new type of sensor capable of detecting ships via a 12-dimensional region of space which marketing wants to call "Subspace." Whatever we call it, our next generation of sensors will be extremely effective.

StringTable.Label: IridiumSensorMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: Our sensor systems are now so complicated that only our most talented internal auditors are capable of reviewing their manufacturing process. But now that they've done it, we've found a few more cost savings to wring out.

StringTable.Label: IridiumSensorMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: During a team building event, one of our sensor managers pointed out that some parts of our sensors don't technically have to exist in this universe any more. By shifting them into a another plane, we can reduce the weight of our entire sensor arrays.

StringTable.Label: IridiumTargetingAssistTech_Dec
StringTable.String: In high risk security situations, improved tactical targeting systems and systems that deter enemy sensors will give our security forces an important competitive advantage.

StringTable.Label: IridiumTargetingSupport_Dec
StringTable.String: Our tactical sensor enhancement and evasive modules will now be capable of supporting an entire fleet, giving our fleet managers an important degree of safety when managing high risk security situations.

StringTable.Label: IridiumXenoArcheology_Dec
StringTable.String: A group of aliens known as the Precursors once called this space home. Their relics offer hints of the incredible technology they had, and we'd be doing a disservice to our business to not try and capitalize on every such find.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPrecursorStudies_Dec
StringTable.String: Our early studies of Precursor relics has revealed the basic guidelines with which we should frame our research efforts. All future Precursor research efforts should greatly benefit from this work.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPrecursorRelicFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: By moving our best researchers into our Precursor studies department, we hope to boost that department's productivity and the pace of their research.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPrecursorRelicFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: Our staff seem incredibly excited by the idea of the Precursors, and have speculated wildly about the nature of their civilization and markets. With some effort, we could help boost this impact new relics have on our culture.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPrecursorRelicFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: Anything having to do with the Precursors is proving incredibly lucrative in the markets, quickly inspiring copycat designs and motifs. With the right product planning, we should be able to capitalize on that more fully.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPrecursorExploitation_Dec
StringTable.String: Our Precursor Studies department requires unique and expensive equipment to do their work. But with it, they predict that they'll soon be able to start recreating Precursor technology. Marketing's already salivating at the prospect.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPrecursorEngineering_Dec
StringTable.String: Making Precursor-like technology will require specialized equipment and massively increased security measures for protecting our trade secrets. But the market's appetite for this equipment will surely make all the costs worth it.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPrecursorUnderstanding_Dec
StringTable.String: We're now capable of building equipment nearly as well as the Precursors themselves, and are as close to understanding them and their markets as we've ever been.

StringTable.Label: IridiumLifeSupport_Name
StringTable.String: Range Extension

StringTable.Label: IridiumLifeSupport_Dec
StringTable.String: Life support is the limiting factor restricting our ships' effective ranges. And given the stringent requirements required by workplace health committees, something we can't scrimp on. Improved life support will be necessary to ensure our growth rate.

StringTable.Label: IridiumLifeSupportOptimization1_Name
StringTable.String: Improved Range

StringTable.Label: IridiumLifeSupportOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Another factor to consider when improving life support: the expense we go to train our ships' crews. Improving their life support systems isn't just ethical; it protects our investment as well.

StringTable.Label: IridiumLifeSupportOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: There's no excuse for spending wastefully, no matter the line of business. Even something as vital as life support needs to be constructed as cost effectively as possible.

StringTable.Label: IridiumLifeSupportOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Reducing the weight of our life support systems will leave more room for equipment which actually earns revenue.

StringTable.Label: IridiumSupportFieldGeneration_Name
StringTable.String: Market Extension

StringTable.Label: IridiumSupportFieldGeneration_Dec
StringTable.String: The winner of our latest Life Support Systems Design/Build contract is proposing a force field based life support system that uses fields to convey nutrients to the crew. This innovative solution should help extend the range of our ships even more.

StringTable.Label: IridiumSupportFieldFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: An even more nutrient dense version of sludge, aerated to increase the volume delivered to the crew, allows our ships to travel farther, while minimizing on some of the mess issues we've been dealing with.

StringTable.Label: IridiumSupportFieldFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: Along with cleaning up the issues we had with floating globs of nutrient sludge, R & D has found a number of ways to fabricate our field based life support systems more economically as well.

StringTable.Label: IridiumSupportFieldFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: A rising star in our logistics department noted that we could minimize our life support mass requirements by preferentially hiring smaller crew members. Our crews now shrink by the day.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPromethionSupportSystems_Dec
StringTable.String: A Promethion Support System improves upon our existing systems by inserting nutrients and oxygen directly into the organism being sustained. This dramatically cuts back on waste, albeit at the cost of somewhat reduced workplace morale.

StringTable.Label: IridiumLifeSupportMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: Reducing the cost of our life support systems while maintaining workplace morale is proving a tricky challenge. We've found that including some mild stimulants in the nutrients helps a bit.

StringTable.Label: IridiumLifeSupportMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: Embedding tiny Promethion field emitters in the nutrients themselves saves us the weight of the heavy fixed equipment. Used emitters are collected in the waste stream and cleaned for reuse, though we kind of gloss over that part in the brochure.

StringTable.Label: IridiumLosslessSupportSystems_Dec
StringTable.String: The final improvement to our life support systems has made them almost perfectly efficient, and to our crews' delight, much less humiliating to use. No further improvements seem necessary, or even possible.

StringTable.Label: IridiumSupportFieldMastery_Name
StringTable.String: Long Range Convoys

StringTable.Label: IridiumSupportFieldMastery_Dec
StringTable.String: Standardized nutrient blocks will allow for life support responsibilities to be offloaded to other ships in a fleet, or even supplemented by an appropriately equipped starport, allowing for much more flexible fleet compositions.

StringTable.Label: IridiumExplorationExtention_Dec
StringTable.String: Promethion technology will make our fleet-support vessels even more capable, as it will for our starbase support modules. The flexibility this imparts can't be overstated; our fleet managers will be able to build more useful fleets than ever.

StringTable.Label: IridiumOrbitalManufacturing_Dec
StringTable.String: Orbital environments present certain unique advantages and challenges for our construction divisions. The potential for building massive structures is the main draw, but there will be a lot of work to get there.

StringTable.Label: IridiumOrbitalSpecialization1_Dec
StringTable.String: The biggest problem with orbital construction is the incredible training requirements needed for the workers. Anything we can do to improve or streamline that process should result in faster construction.

StringTable.Label: IridiumOrbitalSpecialization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Orbits are far more complicated than most laypersons understand, and adapting our logistical practices to accommodate their quirks has proven difficult. But if we manage it, our ability to support our fleets should improve significantly.

StringTable.Label: IridiumOrbitalSpecialization2_Dec
StringTable.String: The more equipment we can carry in our ships' hulls, the more revenue they'll be capable of generating. Or, for our security forces, the more revenue protection equipment they'll be capable of carrying.

StringTable.Label: IridiumZeroGravityConstruction_Dec
StringTable.String: A new round of public tenders has found us a set of contractors with the equipment and personal to scale up our orbital construction, opening the door to a new class of vessels.

StringTable.Label: IridiumZeroGravityOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Requiring our contractors to minimize the use of replacement-spec materials during construction should result in our hulls being a bit tougher, which will come in handy in any high risk security situations.

StringTable.Label: IridiumZeroGravityOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Forcing our contractors to improve their space-based worksite planning will ensure they have the materials they need in the places they need them prior to construction, minimizing delays and lowering costs.

StringTable.Label: IridiumZeroGravityOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: Our contractors have found a clever way of embedding tertiary ship systems within hollow structural elements, saving space that can be used for revenue generating or protection equipment.

StringTable.Label: IridiumLargeScaleConstruction_Dec
StringTable.String: A number of contractors have come forward promising the ability to build even larger vessels. Overpromising and underdelivering is a problem with these guys, so we'll have to ensure we have strong performance clauses in their contract.

StringTable.Label: IridiumOrbitalConstructionFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: Our hulls will be more resilient if they can deform under stress in predictable ways, and our latest efforts to build crumple zones into them should result in significantly tougher hulls.

StringTable.Label: IridiumOrbitalConstructionFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: A new variety of construction drone is capable of performing without oversight for extended periods, allowing for around the clock construction with significantly reduced crews. This will save both time and costs.

StringTable.Label: IridiumOrbitalConstructionFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: A ship with a well designed interior can provide more usable space than a ship of the same size. Anything we can do to increase the flexibility and packing capacity of a ship will ultimately result in more useful ships.

StringTable.Label: IridiumMassiveScaleConstruction_Dec
StringTable.String: Our ships are now the largest the galaxy has ever seen, a potent symbol of our market force. With these behemoths in our fleets, Iridium business has never been more secure.

StringTable.Label: IridiumHullMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: Building ships on the scale we do now can be horrendously expensive. But on that scale, new efficiencies are easy to find, and quickly magnify into significant savings.

StringTable.Label: IridiumHullMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: Experimental work with pocket dimensions allows us to store necessary but rarely used equipment in a place that doesn't technically exist, saving more room for the equipment we need to exist all the time.

StringTable.Label: IridiumHullStrengthening_Dec
StringTable.String: Strengthening fields embedded within the structure of our vessels will make them more resilient, thus protecting the significant investment that those vessels represent. Also, the crews will be safer.

StringTable.Label: IridiumHullRepairSystems_Dec
StringTable.String: Our latest iteration of strengthening field technology will now allow us to partially repair battle-damaged hulls in situations where time allows it.

StringTable.Label: IridiumSelfHealingHulls_Dec
StringTable.String: Repair systems composed of tiny little automatons smaller than the eye can see will be capable of repairing our ships and starbases during combat situations, offering obvious benefits to our security department.

StringTable.Label: IridiumCarrierTech_Dec
StringTable.String: In security situations, overwhelming force often leads to less losses suffered. Carrier based security fighters will let us bring many weapons to bear on high risk threats, overwhelming their ability to effectively attack us.

StringTable.Label: IridiumHighCapacityCarriers_Dec
StringTable.String: High capacity carriers that use the latest generation of compact fighters coming on the market will allow our security forces more revenue protection capacity than ever before.

StringTable.Label: IridiumInterstellarLogistics_Dec
StringTable.String: Middle management gets a bad reputation, but it's these men and women who do the hard work of keeping our fleets supplied with the fuel, ammunition, and people needed to do their jobs. Improved logistical capacity benefits our entire enterprise.

StringTable.Label: IridiumLogisticalOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Relativistic travel wreaked havoc with our record keeping systems, but now that we've found ways to accommodate that, all of our internal operational efficiency metrics are way up. We should see improved fleet logistical support as a result.

StringTable.Label: IridiumLogisticalOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: Complicated operations such as asteroid mining are a figurative gold mine for our quality managers, the sea of complex activities a perfect place to hunt for efficiency improvements. Their work should lead to increased mining production.

StringTable.Label: IridiumLogisticalOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: The costs to maintain our shipyards is one of the most troublesome aspects of growing our business on this scale. Reducing their maintenance costs should help boost our net income substantially.

StringTable.Label: IridiumFleetLogisticsTech_Dec
StringTable.String: To our dismay we found that our logistical operations weren't as scalable as we'd originally conceived. It's taken much overhauling of internal processes, as well as letting a few people go, but we should now finally be able to support larger fleets.

StringTable.Label: IridiumDeepSpaceLogistics_Dec
StringTable.String: As our business grows ever larger, the complexity of our logistical operations increases exponentially. A new generation of supply drones and cloaked supply caches will be necessary to keep all corners of our business well stocked.

StringTable.Label: IridiumGalacticLogistics_Dec
StringTable.String: We have mastered mass-scale logistics like no other enterprise, our ability to deliver supplies where they're needed when they're needed the envy of all our competitors. This is really exciting stuff, and we can all take a great deal of pride in it.

StringTable.Label: IridiumInterstellarMining_Name
StringTable.String: Recourse Procurement

StringTable.Label: IridiumInterstellarMining_Dec
StringTable.String: Resource extraction is the foundation on which our business is laid. We must never rest in our efforts to improve the speed and efficiency with which we mine asteroids.

StringTable.Label: IridiumHighEfficiencyMining_Dec
StringTable.String: The relentless scrutiny we've put on our mining operations has resulted in a number of breakthroughs, resulting in improved high efficiency mines capable of producing more resources than before.

StringTable.Label: IridiumResourceExtraction_Dec
StringTable.String: Subsurface extraction drones will let us crack asteroids from the inside out, speeding up our resource collection efforts dramatically.

StringTable.Label: IridiumLosslessMining_Dec
StringTable.String: Miniaturized resource extraction probes will allow us to extract resources without any losses at all. Additionally, these new drones are intelligent enough to seek out and extract the rarest resources.

StringTable.Label: IridiumWarfareTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Although the Iridium Corporation can see the profit potential of a lasting peace, we can't assume the rest of the galaxy will. We must begin assembling a security force to protect our investments.

StringTable.Label: IridiumWeaponsSystemsTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Even a purely defensive security force will have need for weapons. We've begun development on weapon systems which we should immediately begin assessing for their current and future applications.

StringTable.Label: IridiumBeamWeapons_Dec
StringTable.String: For sheer intimidation power alone, there are few weapons more effective than beam weapons. Ideal as a deterrent, they also have enormous destructive potential if our security forces ultimately need it.

StringTable.Label: IridiumBeamWeaponOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Our procurement managers have found a supplier that can provide a new type of ultra transparent focusing crystal, which should help improve the resolution and damage potential of our beam weapons.

StringTable.Label: IridiumBeamWeaponOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: Now that we're buying in volume, prices are starting to come down for the energy storage and transmission equipment our beam weapons rely upon.

StringTable.Label: IridiumBeamWeaponOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Making our beam weapons more mass-efficient will allow our security forces to carry more of them, or even allow our revenue generating ships to carry some, affording them a modest amount of security potential.

StringTable.Label: IridiumMatterDisruption_Dec
StringTable.String: R & D has found a particle capable of disrupting the strong nuclear force, which once weaponized, will result in a beam weapon of unparalleled destructive potential. Armed with this, our security forces will be more secure than ever.

StringTable.Label: IridiumHighEnergyFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: Previous generations of focusing crystals were incapable of handling the quantities of energy our weapons require without fracturing. An adjustment to the growing process should result in more resilient crystals and thus more powerful weapons.

StringTable.Label: IridiumHighEnergyFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: Much of the equipment used in our beam weapons has been over-specced, built to unnecessarily high tolerances at great cost. By revising our procurement standards appropriately, we hope to reduce the manufacturing costs for all our beam weapons.

StringTable.Label: IridiumHighEnergyFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: By relocating the cooling systems of our beam weapons to where they're needed most, we can cut down on the excess of plumbing these weapons are notorious for. Our beam weapons should now be lighter than ever.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPlasmaProjection_Dec
StringTable.String: We went to the market for our next generation of beam weapon, the winner of the RFP proposing a new form of collimated plasma weapon which promises to be able to generate far more destructive power than previous systems.

StringTable.Label: IridiumBeamWeaponMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: It's taken a little while for our supplier to work some of the kinks out of the process used for making plasma containment field generators, but now that they have, we expect to see cost savings passed along to us.

StringTable.Label: IridiumBeamWeaponMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: After our latest mass-reduction efforts, our contractors state that we're now running up on the hard limits of what this universe will allow in terms of energy density. No amount of white board brainstorming will get around this now.

StringTable.Label: IridiumEnergyPhasing_Dec
StringTable.String: An internal competition has inspired a team within our R & D department to synthesize something called the phaser particle, which can be used in an enormously destructive weapon. With this, our security forces will be really very secure.

StringTable.Label: IridiumDoomRayTech_Dec
StringTable.String: There are unfortunately few markets for the Doom Ray, because really, who would we dare sell it to? An improvement of our phasers, with massive increased rates of matter-breakdown reaction, Doom Rays will be effective against even the hardest armor.

StringTable.Label: IridiumBeamWeaponAugmentation_Dec
StringTable.String: Beam augmentation systems use an external field to improve the energy storage capacity and damage output of our beam weapons. A security fleet equipped with such a device should prove much more capable of dealing with threats.

StringTable.Label: IridiumHighEnergyTransfer_Dec
StringTable.String: One of our suppliers has developed a new system which allows a beam weapon to be much more effective at penetrating shields. Even more impressive, a variation of the same system will allow our own shields to partially absorb our competitors' beam attacks.

StringTable.Label: IridiumHighEnergyMagnification_Dec
StringTable.String: With our latest augmentation systems, our beam weapons can disable shields entirely. Few of our competitors will pose a serious threat to our security forces now.

StringTable.Label: IridiumMissileWeapons_Dec
StringTable.String: Missile systems offer the most economical means of self-defense for our security fleets, making them one of the more attractive methods of revenue protection.

StringTable.Label: IridiumMissileOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Making our missile launchers shoot faster is a simple, almost childishly obvious idea. Which is why about twelve managers now claim credit for it. Actually implementing it was much harder, but isn't that always the way?

StringTable.Label: IridiumMissileOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: Everything we can do to improve upon the already excellent cost-effectiveness of our missile systems will make it a little easier to sell security allocation budgets to the board.

StringTable.Label: IridiumMissileOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: If we dedicate some research effort to reducing the mass of our missile weapon systems, we'll have room for putting more of them on our security ships, increasing their deterrence potential.

StringTable.Label: IridiumHarpoonTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Our latest self-guided deterrence vector, the Harpoon Missile, vastly improves upon previous generations in terms of speed, range and destructive potential.

StringTable.Label: IridiumWarheadFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: Lightweight, shaped charge warheads offer the same destructive potential at a reduced mass. This leaves room for additional propellant, allowing our missiles to travel much longer distances.

StringTable.Label: IridiumWarheadFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: A concerted effort to develop new, more stable forms of explosive should result in weapons which are far safer, and consequently cheaper to make. Workplace accidents are an incredible drain on our financial resources.

StringTable.Label: IridiumWarheadFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: Shaped-charge warheads weigh less than conventional warheads of equivalent damage potential. That weight savings can allow our security ships to carry more missile launchers or other revenue protection equipment.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPhotonicWarheads_Dec
StringTable.String: A new system has come on the market which uses a high energy burst of photons at the moment of impact to pierce both shields and armor and shield systems. Called Photonic Warheads, these represent the state of the art in self defensive technology.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPayloadMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: If we lean on our supplier to pay their workers less, we can probably get missiles made for cheaper. They're the only company that makes missiles, so it's not like those workers can go anywhere else.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPayloadMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: Thanks to a new form of ultra lightweight casing, our next generation of missile systems will be lighter than ever. They also now come in a broad selection of pleasing colors.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPhotonTorpedos_Dec
StringTable.String: The spec-sheet sounds promising: broad-range high-def photon-based piercing system, coupled with the latest next-gen AM warheads. Whatever all that means, these new photon missiles promise to meet our security forces' deterrence needs.

StringTable.Label: IridiumNightmareTorpedoTech_Dec
StringTable.String: The Nightmare torpedo was a clever bit of marketing, the name for the device preceding the invention of the torpedo by several years. Still, these are horrific weapons of immense potential. The warning labels alone are pretty terrifying.

StringTable.Label: IridiumMissileAugmentation_Dec
StringTable.String: R & D has developed a new system that compliments our existing missile platforms, improving their tracking ability and range. This will not only make our security fleets safer, it also opens up a new accessories market for us.

StringTable.Label: IridiumAdvancedMissileGuidance_Dec
StringTable.String: Losing missiles to point defense systems no longer has to be a cost of doing defensive business. Our latest missile support systems provide the counter-counter measures to defeat enemy PD, reduce missile wastage and boost our bottom line.

StringTable.Label: IridiumIntelligentWarheads_Dec
StringTable.String: The latest intelligent cluster warheads can target enemy point defense system, allowing later salvos to pass by unmolested. And R & D has found a way to improve our missile support accessories even more, allowing for increased accuracy and range.

StringTable.Label: IridiumKineticWeapons_Dec
StringTable.String: Kinetic weapons provide a straightforward means of self-defense for our security forces, using powerful electromagnets to accelerate projectiles to incredible speeds.

StringTable.Label: IridiumKineticOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Smaller barrels and the smaller projectiles that go with them will allow us to increase the muzzle velocity of our kinetic weapons while using the same charging coils. This won't increase the damage of the system, but will boost its effective range.

StringTable.Label: IridiumKineticOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: A new supplier of electromagnetic coils has begun offering them to us at an exceptionally good price, which should lead to lower prices for all our kinetic weapons.

StringTable.Label: IridiumKineticOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Our existing supplier has managed to make the capacitors and associated charging systems of our kinetic weapons significantly lighter.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPulseCannonTech_Dec
StringTable.String: At a recent conference, researchers revealed their work on using clusters of particles to replace the slugs used by traditional kinetic weapons. Called pulse cannons, R & D believes these will be much more powerful than previous generations of weapons.

StringTable.Label: IridiumKineticAccelerationFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: The newest superconductors enable us to impart energy to our projectiles much more rapidly. The total energy imparted isn't increased that much, but we should be able to accelerate smaller masses to higher speeds, leading to longer effective ranges.

StringTable.Label: IridiumKineticAccelerationFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: Due to the incredible volume the Iridium Corporation is now ordering them in, our supplier are able to offer us superconductors at very good prices, which should reduce the unit cost of our kinetic weapons substantially.

StringTable.Label: IridiumKineticAccelerationFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: The newest superconductors on the market have much less strenuous cooling requirements, which will make our kinetic weapons much lighter to carry around.

StringTable.Label: IridiumGravitonThrower_Dec
StringTable.String: R & D has found a way to synthesize gravitons, which when used by our particle cannons, can massively damage the hulls of high-risk security threats.

StringTable.Label: IridiumKineticMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: Increasing use of automation has not only reduced our labor costs, but decreased the failure rate of our kinetic weapon systems. Prices have come down significantly, and we're told the workers are all probably landing on their feet elsewhere.

StringTable.Label: IridiumKineticMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: Our kinetic weapons are now remarkably mass-efficient, allowing our security forces to carry more of them and project far greater deterrent potential than they could even a few years ago.

StringTable.Label: IridiumQuantumDrivers_Dec
StringTable.String: Our latest weapon is capable of firing small particles, which upon impact, pull in a tremendous amount of mass from a neighboring dimension. Although incredibly devastating, the legal impact of using another dimension's mass is still being explored.

StringTable.Label: IridiumSingularityDrivers_Dec
StringTable.String: Singularity drivers are the apex of kinetic technology, micro-singularities capable of ravaging the ships of any high-risk security threats that dare menace Iridium growth potential.

StringTable.Label: IridiumKineticAugmentation_Dec
StringTable.String: Inertial dampening systems allow projectiles to be fired at much higher velocities than this universe should allow. A security fleet equipped with such a system will see the range of all kinetic weapons boosted substantially.

StringTable.Label: IridiumMassManipulation_Dec
StringTable.String: Miniaturizing our inertial dampening fields to fit inside projectiles allows them to generate dense outer surfaces that provide enhanced armor penetration capacity. And our kinetic augmentation systems have been incrementally improved once again.

StringTable.Label: IridiumInertialMagnification_Dec
StringTable.String: Our projectiles are now capable of attacking enemy armor plate directly, fracturing it upon impact. And the latest version of our fleet wide inertial modifying systems now promises even more rapid threat-neutralization capacity than previous models.

StringTable.Label: IridiumAcquisitionTech_Name
StringTable.String: Acquisitions

StringTable.Label: IridiumAcquisitionTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Improves military effectiveness.

StringTable.Label: IridiumAcquisitionTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Our business must grow. And when the galaxy doesn't provide us empty worlds to grow with, we may have to acquire them from other parties. Developing the tools and techniques to do that now is more than prudent.

StringTable.Label: IridiumAcquisitionSpecialization1_Name
StringTable.String: Weapons Quality

StringTable.Label: IridiumAcquisitionSpecialization1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Improves the quality of our weapon systems.

StringTable.Label: IridiumAcquisitionSpecialization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Dedicating internal R & D resources to improving the effectiveness of our weapons systems will ensure that when our security forces need to use them, they won't need to use them twice.

StringTable.Label: IridiumAcquisitionSpecialization2_Name
StringTable.String: Defense Quality

StringTable.Label: IridiumAcquisitionSpecialization2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Improves the quality of our defensive systems.

StringTable.Label: IridiumAcquisitionSpecialization2_Dec
StringTable.String: A concentrated focus to improve the defensive technologies which protect our security fleets will ensure that those valuable assets aren't wasted when conducting security or acquisition operations.

StringTable.Label: IridiumAcquisitionSpecialization3_Name
StringTable.String: Ship Quality

StringTable.Label: IridiumAcquisitionSpecialization3_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Improves the hit points of our ships.

StringTable.Label: IridiumAcquisitionSpecialization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Making the ships used by our security fleets more durable will increase their effectiveness and staying power in high-risk security or acquisition operations.

StringTable.Label: IridiumMilitarizationTech_Dec
StringTable.String: The nice thing about military equipment is how expensive everything is. The overall economic impact we expect to see from militarizing our ground and orbital structures will be substantial.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPlanetaryInvasion_Dec
StringTable.String: Planetary landers will be necessary for our security forces to be capable of acquiring a world. This is always a difficult decision to make, but in environments where our growth is constrained, there may be no other choice.

StringTable.Label: IridiumInvasionOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Planetary bombardments are undeniably an effective way of lowering the risk to our security forces during a high-risk acquisition. But given the potential damage to infrastructure, this shouldn't be considered lightly.

StringTable.Label: IridiumInvasionOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: Information warfare will hamper the ability of hostile counterparties to defend against our security forces during acquisitions.

StringTable.Label: IridiumInvasionOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Viral Acquisition Enhancement Deployments will severely weaken any hostile counterparties who might wish to oppose our security forces during an acquisition.

StringTable.Label: IridiumStallerMarines_Dec
StringTable.String: If we provide enhanced training to our security forces on ground-based security situations, including hostile acquisitions, we should improve their effectiveness greatly.

StringTable.Label: IridiumGravitationalFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: Powerful gravitational fields can induce flooding and even tectonic activity underneath the feet of hostile counterparties, reducing their ability to impede our acquisitions process.

StringTable.Label: IridiumGravitationalFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: Using powerful graviton beams to induce massive volcanic activity is certainly an effective way to sap the morale of a hostile counterparty, if not remove them from the equation outright.

StringTable.Label: IridiumDroneSoldiers_Dec
StringTable.String: Drones have far greater security potential than conventional, previous generation soldiers, making our ground based security operations that much more effective.

StringTable.Label: IridiumDefenseSystemTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Our vessels, whether revenue generating or security, are too valuable to go unprotected. Considering the unknown hazards this galaxy poses, we should equip them with some form of defensive technology ASAP.

StringTable.Label: IridiumDefensiveSpecialization1_Dec
StringTable.String: The emitters used in our deflector systems are an entirely new technology, and have consequently been very expensive to build. Newer versions on the market appear to have brought the costs down somewhat.

StringTable.Label: IridiumDefensiveSpecialization2_Dec
StringTable.String: The supplier who constructs the feed mechanisms for our point defense systems has delivered a new version capable of higher throughputs. The increased firing rate should make our point defenses marginally more effective.

StringTable.Label: IridiumDefensiveSpecialization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Being such a simple system, armor is a little hard to improve upon, no matter what incentives we embed in our contracts. The best our suppliers have been able to do is cut some weight out of the mounting hardware.

StringTable.Label: IridiumShieldSystems_Dec
StringTable.String: According to the product literature, by increasing the density of our deflector arrays and rearranging their layout, we end up with a new generation of "Shield" systems, capable of providing much greater protection.

StringTable.Label: IridiumShieldOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: A new version of field emitter with higher output capacity will make our shields a bit more effective at no additional cost to us.

StringTable.Label: IridiumShieldOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: Shields are pretty costly, and at least a few spreadsheets have suggested we should consider accepting a higher ship-loss rate instead. Reducing shield costs should quash that argument. And keep our security departments morale up.

StringTable.Label: IridiumShieldOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Our suppliers have found a way to reduce the mass of our shield systems' field emitters. Which leaves room for more of them, or other revenue protection/generation equipment.

StringTable.Label: IridiumBarrierFieldGeneration_Dec
StringTable.String: Barrier Fields are capable of absorbing a portion of incoming offensive energy, thus charging the very shields which will repulse it. This is an incredibly appealing prospect, if only from an energy balance sheet perspective.

StringTable.Label: IridiumBarrierSystemFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: Our new shield supplier has recommended we begin installing newer and more robust models of energy absorber to make our Barrier Fields a bit stronger.

StringTable.Label: IridiumBarrierSystemFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: Our new supplier promises the ability to deliver shield generators at lower costs than before, so long as we promise not to ask too many questions about how they're made. No problem, we said.

StringTable.Label: IridiumBarrierSystemFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: Apparently our shield generations were designed inefficiently by the last contractor so that they could easily trim them down later to hit their performance targets. These errors have since been corrected, reducing the mass of all our shield systems.

StringTable.Label: IridiumForceFieldTech_Dec
StringTable.String: The latest generation of shields on the market promise to be capable of directing vast amounts of energy in the specific direction of incoming hostile energy. Our security forces should be far safer and more effective behind such technology.

StringTable.Label: IridiumShieldMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: A supplier can always be undercut; there's always someone willing to submit a suicidally low bid. Hopefully word doesn't get out we're doing that with our shields though. Our employees like to think we're spending a lot of money on those things.

StringTable.Label: IridiumShieldMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: The latest performance targets to encourage the development of lighter weight shield emitters have finally been hit, our supplier managing to shave a bit more weight off of their charging systems.

StringTable.Label: IridiumInvulnerabilityTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Although incredibly powerful, "Invulnerable" is more of a marketing term than anything else. But it's a good one, so it's sticking. Regardless of how actually invulnerable these shields are, it will help our security forces if everyone thinks they are.

StringTable.Label: IridiumShieldSupportSystems_Dec
StringTable.String: A new form of shield accessory will allow ships to support the shield systems of other ships in a fleet. Along with increasing the survivability of an entire fleet, this creates a new product category for our market of suppliers to begin competing in.

StringTable.Label: IridiumShieldAugmentation_Dec
StringTable.String: Our suppliers have found a new way to reverse engineer the proprietary Barrier Field technology and use it to improve upon our shield augmentation systems, making them stronger than ever.

StringTable.Label: IridiumEnergyFieldManipulation_Dec
StringTable.String: The latest shield accessory on the market is capable of interfering with the shields of hostiles, weakening them substantially. Additionally the standard shield augmentation systems have been improved upon again.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPointDefenses_Dec
StringTable.String: Point defense systems are an excellent means of defending our security forces against missile based threats. They're not so good against other threats, but we're optimistic the market will find a solution for that soon.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPointDefenseOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: A recent firmware update for our point defense firing controllers has made them somewhat more accurate, leading to a stronger overall defensive capability.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPointDefenseOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: Switching to a cheaper source of sub-components has allowed our point defense supplier to pass on some of the savings to us. Not all the savings of course, but that's their prerogative.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPointDefenseOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: The ammunition used by our point defense systems isn't delicate, and had been over-packed in early models of those systems. Using slimmer, more compact ammunition storage modules should lead to overall weight savings for the system.

StringTable.Label: IridiumCounterMeasures_Dec
StringTable.String: At a recent trade fair our procurement managers visited a booth featuring an electronic counter measure system which promises to confuse incoming missile attacks. As soon as we sort out the pricing, we'll have them available for our fleet.

StringTable.Label: IridiumCounterMeasureFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: A simple firmware patch is all that it will take to make our ECM suites more capable of confusing enemy missiles. Automatic updates should also ensure this edge never fades away as a result of improvements in the missile sector.

StringTable.Label: IridiumCounterMeasureFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: Now that we're the biggest, and indeed only customer of our ECM vendor, we can leverage that position to get better prices on their ECM suites. Say it quietly now, but market inefficiencies are great when they work out in our favor.

StringTable.Label: IridiumCounterMeasureFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: The latest update to our ECM suites consolidates some of the equipment into a single module, which causes the overall system to weigh much less.

StringTable.Label: IridiumDroneSentrySystems_Dec
StringTable.String: The latest model of point defense system uses drone platforms to extend the protective envelope around our security vessels. Many of the drones are now also given cute names, to assist with branding.

StringTable.Label: IridiumDroneSystemMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: Our drone supplier found a new manufacturing technique - it looks a little bit like a conveyor belt with a large stamp - that's capable of churning out drones at much lower costs than before.

StringTable.Label: IridiumDroneSystemMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: The newest version of point defense drone comes in a more cube-like shape that makes them much more stackable, saving weight on various drone storage and launching systems.

StringTable.Label: IridiumArreonMissileDefenseTech_Dec
StringTable.String: The brochure for Aereon drones makes them sound incredible. Nano drones. Smart railguns. Adaptive-ECM. High Def Chafe. Something with that many cool adjectives must be good.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPointDefenseSupportSystem_Dec
StringTable.String: Sensor modules which improve the long range tracking ability of our point defenses will enable a single ship to boost the point defense capabilities of an entire security fleet.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPointDefenseAugmentation_Dec
StringTable.String: The newest iteration of point defense accessory module adds improved missile disruptors which enhance the effectiveness of an entire fleet's counter measures, giving our security forces a much needed extra layer of security.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPointDefenseManipulation_Dec
StringTable.String: Fleet-wide drone systems expand the perimeter of our defenses even further. And the newest point defense disruptors will let our own missile attacks more easily penetrate the point defenses of high risk threats.

StringTable.Label: IridiumArmorSystems_Dec
StringTable.String: There's something charmingly retro about armor, and the market is full of brands adorned with decorative rivets and such. Still, even in this age, armor is surprisingly effective, so let's go ahead and use it if it meets our security forces' needs.

StringTable.Label: IridiumArmorOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: A supplier with a new fabrication process promises the ability to deliver denser, more resilient armor panels to us, which should make our security ships a little more capable at fending off high-risk security threats.

StringTable.Label: IridiumArmorOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: A new supplier promises they'll be able to supply armor panels to us at reduced rates. Apparently the last guy was spending too much on unnecessary health & safety protocols for their workers. A shame when that gets passed on to the consumer.

StringTable.Label: IridiumArmorOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: So it turns out those decorative rivets and other adornments were adding unnecessary weight to our already bulky armor systems. Stripping them down to the bare essentials should result in a lighter load to carry around.

StringTable.Label: IridiumDurantiumCompositeTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Durantium was developed by a consortium in our polymers industry. A composite of different substances, Durantium has tremendous damage absorption potential, far in excess of conventional armor plating.

StringTable.Label: IridiumArmorFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: Durantium composites have an unusual problem with cracking completely in half under typical end-of-life stresses. A new after-market lamination process promises to address that, making our ships just a little bit tougher.

StringTable.Label: IridiumArmorFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: Keeping our security ships operational is worth a lot to our business, and we armor them gladly because of it. But if it could be done for less, well, we'd probably armor them a little more gladly.

StringTable.Label: IridiumArmorFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: The latest version of Durantium has a slightly different configuration of layers which results in a lighter product with just the same destruction-avoidance capabilities.

StringTable.Label: IridiumKanviumLaminateTech_Dec
StringTable.String: A new product called Kanvium claims to be a laminated armor product which partially fluidizes on impact to disperse incoming force. Whether that's marketing nonsense or not, it certainly looks more effective at stopping fast moving things.

StringTable.Label: IridiumArmorMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: By considering our armoring needs earlier in the ship design process, our product managers can design ships that remain just as durable while using far less armor. Tough luck for our armor suppliers, but that's the business.

StringTable.Label: IridiumArmorMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: If we involve our armor supplier to get involved in the design process, they might help us find ways to minimize overlap and otherwise maximize the efficiency of our armor placement, leading to reduced overall armor mass.

StringTable.Label: IridiumZeroPointArmorTech_Dec
StringTable.String: The manufacturer of Zero Point Armor explains that it can tap into the zero-point energy of the quantum vacuum, using that energy to confront incoming energy. We have no way of determining if that's true, but it sure looks a lot tougher.

StringTable.Label: IridiumArmorSupportSystems_Dec
StringTable.String: A new type of armor accessory has come on the market, using long range hardening fields to allow a ship to make every piece of armor in a fleet substantially more durable. Our fleet managers are reportedly ecstatic at the news.

StringTable.Label: IridiumArmorEnhancement_Dec
StringTable.String: Thanks to some kind of "polar" device, or possibly just piece of marketing, our fleet-wide armor accessories have gotten even more effective.

StringTable.Label: IridiumIntegrityFieldProjection_Dec
StringTable.String: The latest model of armor accessory is capable of inducing material fluidization and shape recovery in impacted armor within a fleet. The manufacturer promises that a single ship with one of these can make a fleet almost invulnerable.

StringTable.Label: IridiumEconomicsTech_Name
StringTable.String: Economics

StringTable.Label: IridiumEconomicsTech_Dec
StringTable.String: The presence of other sentient life in this galaxy represents the single-most important opportunity for market growth our business has ever been presented with. We must do everything we can to better communicate with our potential customers.

StringTable.Label: IridiumTranslatorTech_Dec
StringTable.String: A crowdsourcing effort to analyze the fragments of alien speech we've received has resulted in a complete understanding of their languages. The Universal Translator developed alongside this effort will let us communicate with our future customers.

StringTable.Label: IridiumDiplomaticSpecialization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Now that we've identified what they are, our diplomats should be able to use the hand gestures and guttural tics that various species respond well too.

StringTable.Label: IridiumInterstellarGovernance_Dec
StringTable.String: How to manage a business which literally spans the stars is an interesting challenge. Adding more layers to our org chart could lead to gross inefficiencies. But given the scale of our business, what other choices do we have?

StringTable.Label: IridiumPoliticalSpecialization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Giving more control to local management can reduce overall corporate cohesion, but the informed decisions that only local managers can make should help boost local economies.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPoliticalSpecialization2_Dec
StringTable.String: Policies which boost job satisfaction will obviously benefit the corporate image we're trying to build. Along with increased internal approval, this image should also greatly boost our diplomatic efforts.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPoliticalSpecialization3_Dec
StringTable.String: There's no shame in picking a middle of the road approach to governance. Considering the diversity of the markets presented to us, enormous profit could be had by trying to be all things to all people.

StringTable.Label: IridiumGalacticGovernance_Dec
StringTable.String: Increasing the say of our workers in determining our overall corporate direction is a novel idea. But the increased worker satisfaction and productivity gains we expect to see should make it worth the risk.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPoliticalFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: A focus on increasing our industrial capacity will mean more motivational seminars, productivity awards, and rigorous internal quality control measures. Productivity shall be the watchword by which the Iridium Corporation lives by.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPoliticalFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: A management philosophy based on maximizing trading revenue is perhaps the most natural fit for our people, given its obvious impact to our bottom line. Our "aggressive" market research efforts should also benefit from this approach.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPoliticalFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: A commitment to R & D will involve internal competitions, rapid promotion from within, and the swift purchase of sub-contractors with advanced products. We shall be known as leaders in the industry. Every industry.

StringTable.Label: IridiumInterstellarDemocracyTech_Dec
StringTable.String: An employee share ownership plan will not only allow our workers the ability to share in our profits, but also have a direct say in our organization's leadership. The increase in approval and productivity is expected to be enormous.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPoliticalMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: Putting the entire Iridium Corporation and its network of suppliers on a war footing isn't something which should be done lightly. But when aggressive acquisition is our only feasible path towards growth, we may have no other choice.

StringTable.Label: IridiumPoliticalMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: In an environment featuring open markets, where our growth prospects are unrestrained by closed minds, a peaceful management philosophy will ensure our corporate image is as widely admired as it can be.

StringTable.Label: IridiumStarFederationTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Decades of relentless improvements to our internal processes has led to this, the pinnacle of corporate governance. All other organizational models pale in comparison to ours.

StringTable.Label: IridiumDiplomacyTech_Name
StringTable.String: Contracts

StringTable.Label: IridiumDiplomacyTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Making formal treaties with our neighbors will ensure both borders and markets remain open to us, easing the path towards pain-free growth.

StringTable.Label: IridiumDiplomaticOptimization1_Name
StringTable.String: Economic Contract

StringTable.Label: IridiumDiplomaticOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: An economic treaty will remove the tariffs and import bans that choke growth. These should benefit both parties, though if that's not possible we'll ensure that it at least benefits us.

StringTable.Label: IridiumDiplomaticOptimization2_Name
StringTable.String: Cultural Contract

StringTable.Label: IridiumDiplomaticOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: A cultural treaty will increase the influence we have with our neighbors. Our traders and other corporate ambassadors will help them see the light of a civilization dedicated to unrestricted access to markets.

StringTable.Label: IridiumDiplomaticOptimization3_Name
StringTable.String: Research Contract

StringTable.Label: IridiumDiplomaticOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Information sharing agreements with our neighbors could benefit our internal R & D division greatly, and allow both parties to accelerate their research efforts.

StringTable.Label: IridiumInterstellarAlliances_Name
StringTable.String: Interstellar Partnership

StringTable.Label: IridiumInterstellarAlliances_Dec
